Macon.Douglass Theatre:
The Douglass Theatre is a theatre in Macon, Georgia named for its founder Charles Henry Douglass, an African-American entrepreneur who was an established theatre developer well versed in the vaudeville and entertainment business. According to the Douglass Theatre website, the Douglass was a part of the Theater Owners Bookers Association – a chain of 40 theatres that served as an agency for many African American artists and performers.
The theatre remained in operation until the 1970s.
